item.title: Joanne add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "It takes a very long time to become young." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Joanne add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Clothes make the man. Naked people have little or no influence on society." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Joanne add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "Life is easy to chronicle, but bewildering to practice." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Joanne add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "Mistrust all enterprises that require new clothes." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Joanne add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "Life' wrote a friend of mine, 'is a public performance on the violin, in which you must learn the instrument as you go along." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Joanne add a quote by Edward Lear
item.description: "And hand in hand, on the edge of the sand, They danced by the light of the moon." -- Edward Lear

item.title: Joanne add a quote by Lydia Davis
item.description: "There seemed to be three choices: to give up trying to love anyone, to stop being selfish, or to learn to love a person while continuing to be selfish." -- Lydia Davis

item.title: Joanne add a quote by Thomas Paine
item.description: "These are the times that try men's souls." -- Thomas Paine

item.title: Joanne add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "A little Madness in the Spring Is wholesome even for the King." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Joanne add a quote by Arthur Schopenhauer
item.description: "Compassion is the basis of morality." -- Arthur Schopenhauer

item.title: Joanne add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "The most certain sign of wisdom is cheerfulness. " -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Joanne add a quote by Phyllis McGinley
item.description: "A bit of trash now and then is good for the severest reader. It provides the necessary roughage in the literary diet." -- Phyllis McGinley

item.title: Joanne add a quote by Sean O'Casey
item.description: "Laughter is wine for the soul - laughter soft, or loud and deep, tinged through with seriousness - the hilarious declaration made by man that life is worth living." -- Sean O'Casey

item.title: Joanne add a quote by August Wilson
item.description: "Confront the dark parts of yourself, and work to banish them with illumination and forgiveness. Your willingness to wrestle with your demons will cause your angels to sing." -- August Wilson

item.title: Joanne add a quote by Joseph Brodsky
item.description: "The surest defense against Evil is extreme individualism, originality of thinking, whimsicality, even—if you will—eccentricity." -- Joseph Brodsky

item.title: Joanne add a quote by Jamaica Kincaid
item.description: "There's something to be said about a slightly plump person—you have just enough of too much." -- Jamaica Kincaid

item.title: Joanne add a quote by Countee Cullen
item.description: "There is no secret to success except hard work and getting something indefinable which we call 'the breaks." -- Countee Cullen

item.title: Joanne add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "Let the wild rumpus start!" -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Joanne add a quote by Amy Bloom
item.description: "You are imperfect, permanently and inevitably flawed. And you are beautiful." -- Amy Bloom

item.title: Joanne add a quote by Vikram Seth
item.description: "God save us from people who mean well." -- Vikram Seth

item.title: Joanne add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "You can't depend on your eyes when your imagination is out of focus." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Joanne add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Curiouser and curiouser!" -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Joanne add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "You know, Hobbes, some days even my lucky rocket ship underpants don't help." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Joanne add a quote by Hilary Mantel
item.description: "It is the absence of facts that frightens people: the gap you open, into which they pour their fears, fantasies, desires." -- Hilary Mantel
